meanings.definition: Past tense of overtake: to catch up with and pass by
meanings.sent1: The speedy cheetah overtaken the slow turtle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The car overtaken the bicycle on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise was surprised to be overtaken by the hare.
meanings.sent4: The river overtaken the small boat, carrying it downstream.
meanings.sent5: The wind overtaken the leaves, swirling them into a whirlwind.

meanings.definition: Past participle of overtake: caught up with and passed by
meanings.sent1: The runner had overtaken all his competitors in the marathon.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds had overtaken the clear sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat had overtaken the mouse in a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The darkness had overtaken the room, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent5: The vines had overtaken the old house, covering it completely.

meanings.definition: Adjective: overwhelmed or overpowered by something
meanings.sent1: She felt overtaken by emotions when she received the surprise gift.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was overtaken by exhaustion after climbing the steep mountain.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked overtaken with joy when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: The student was overtaken by confusion during the difficult exam.
meanings.sent5: The city was overtaken by a sense of unity after the successful charity event.
